basics.name: David Lash
basics.label: Professor
basics.summary: Assitant Professor of Computer Science at Aurora University

courses: Software Engineering, Software Metrics, Design of Experiments, Advanced Sofwtare Engineering
Software Engineering, Advanced Sofwtare Engineering, Theory of Computing, Programming Languages
Atrificial Intelligence, Real-Time Systems, Operating Systems, Computation Complexity, Algorithms Analysis

highlights: Software Engineering, Capstone, Java OOP, Data Structures
Web Devlopment, Advanced Web Development, Database, Introduction to Programming, Mobile Development
Lead developer for several web-based data warehousing projects. Led and participated in Scum teams from 3-5 to develop
and support software. Technologies include PHP, Laravel, Java, C#, Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server, Linux and DB Admin,
Network Monitoring and control, System Installation, Apache Web Server Admin, System Egineering, Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing
IT Manager (5 direct reports) responsible for standards definition, computer systems architecture, engineering,
performance tuning, and product evaluation. Engineered 6 HPUX/Oracle Systems Architecture and configuration connected
to an EMC storage array with 600 GB of total data space.
Led the project to install and industrialize the environment for production that included HP OpenView, ITO, and omni-backup

work.summary: Lead IT Engineer and Software Developer for the IT Department. Evaluated hardware, built business cases, led
disaster recovery teams, led teams of system admins, built network and system montioring tools,
evaluated and deployed distributed backup/restore software, led quality assurance teams, and interfaced with IT customers.

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
